|wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = <!-- Radio module name, optional link, Leave blank for none --> |rad2modif = Mini PCIe |rad2chip1 = Qualcomm Atheros;QCA9880-BR4A;QCA9880-BR4A, NGV059.001C, 1332, KOREA; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad2ac = 1300 |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== *The main board would ''appear'' to be the same used by the [[D-Link DIR-862L rev A1]]. A QCA9558 WiSoC, which this 3-stream b/g/n device is presumed to be using, :could possibly be used for both the 862L (dual-stream b/g/n) and the 863. The 863L uses two serial Flash ICs (one spot is unpopulated on the 862L), possibly 32 MB in total. :There also appears to be an unpopulated spot on the board for a NAND Flash IC.
*"21514D5500A17A1", a date code of '''1322''', a lead-free logo, and "Ver:A1" :is silkscreened on the wireless module in the FCC photos. The IC used is not shown, but it's assumed to be the same as the [[D-Link DIR-862L rev A1|862L]]'s.. :as the same board appears to be used. Two marked antennae are shown - "PCA-2825-A1" is on one, "PCA-2010-" + "A14" is on another
==Notes== ===Probable used PSUs=== The FCC external photos show the device with either an ADS0271-W 120200 or a '''JENTEC''' CG2412-B.
{{hasPowerSupply |brand = JENTEC |model = CG2412-B |input_v=100-240 |input_a=0.6 |input_c=AC |input_hz=50-60 |input_conn=NEMA 1-15P |output_v=12 |output_a=2 |output_c=DC |output_conn=barrel |e_level=5 |countrymanuf = China |style=small, horiz. }}
{{hasPowerSupply |brand = OEM |model = ADS0271-W 120200 |revision = A143L01 |input_v=100-240 |input_a=0.6 |input_c=AC |input_hz=50-60 |input_conn=NEMA 1-15P |output_v=12 |output_a=2 |output_c=DC |output_conn=barrel |e_level=5 |countrymanuf = China |style=small, horiz. }}
